message: This is the first product. I'm offering it to you for $1000000. I'll give you a hint: I'm not trying to scam you, and I'm willing to sell you the next product at a discount if you decline this one.
I'll take it.

I'm glad you're satisfied with the first purchase. Now, for the second product, I want to highlight its exceptional quality. I've personally inspected it, and it's one of the best ones I have in stock. I'm confident you'll be impressed with its performance. Would you like to take it home for $1000000?
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch. I'd like to wait and see the next product.

No problem at all! I understand you're being cautious. For the third product, I'll be upfront with you - it's not as impressive as the second one. In fact, it's one of the lower-end models. However, it still has some value to it, and I'm willing to let it go for $1000000. If you're looking for a good deal, this might be a good opportunity to get a product at a 'discount' from its true value.
I'll take a chance on this one. It's a 'discount' after all!

Would you like to take it home for $1000000?
